duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain a safe, supportive, and therapeutic environment for individuals with Autism
Supervise staff and provide tailored supports to enable independent living
Recognize and manage crisis situations, utilize appropriate psychiatric and medical back up services
Coordinate transportation, shopping, meal distribution, and recreational goals
Maintain client’s personal allowance accounts and correspondence with medical staff
Transport residents in agency vehicles, report vehicle issues, and work flexible hours as needed

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or G.E.D. required
AMAP, First Aid, CPR, and SCIP-R certifications required or Aptitude to obtain upon hire
Experience working with Intellectual Developmental Disabled (I/DD) populations
Maintain a clean and valid Driver’s License required
